benchmark_details.name: COM2SENSE (Complementary Commonsense)
benchmark_details.overview: A new commonsense reasoning benchmark dataset comprising 4,000 natural language true/false statements, with each sample paired with its complementary counterpart. It aims to assess AI's commonsense reasoning ability with a pairwise accuracy metric.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a challenging evaluation benchmark for commonsense reasoning abilities in NLP models.

data.source: Collected via Amazon Mechanical Turk (MTurk) with an adversarial model-in-the-loop approach.
data.annotation: Crowdsourced, with quality checks by experts.

methodology.calculation: Pairwise accuracy requires both statements in a pair to be correct.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better commonsense reasoning ability.
methodology.baseline_results: UniÔ¨ÅedQA-3B achieves ~71% standard accuracy and ~51% pairwise accuracy.
methodology.validation: Dataset validation was conducted by internal members for consistency and quality.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Personal information of workers was discarded during dataset creation.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: This work has been reviewed by the IRB and granted exempt status.
